is located in Dhanbad district of
. The Barakar River forms the border with West Bengal.
Maithon can be reached by train, bus or car, from
From Howrah Station catch trains heading for

or Kumardubi (KMME). Maithon is 30 km from Asansol, local auto will charge approx Rs-300-400. From Kumardubi, Maithon is only 9 km, local auto charges Rs.100.

By train one can also go from Kolkata via Barakar railway station. Maithon is 8 km from Barakar. Convenient trains from Kolkata are: 
# Black Diamond Express/13317 (Departure-06:15; Arrival-10:06)
# Howrah Dhanbad AC Express/12385 (D-08:30; A-11:37)
# Jammu Tawi Express /13151 (D-11:45; A-16:00)
# Shaktipunj /11448 (D-14:35; A-17:56)
# Coalfiled Express/ 12339 (D-17:20; A-20:45)
Doon Express and Howrah-Mumbai Mail via Allahabad also have stoppages at Barakar but around mid-night.
By bus you can reach Asansol, from there go by auto or a hired car (Rs-500-600).
by road it is an approximately 250 km drive. Roads are good, except for the Panagarh stretch.

value: content= one of the four dams of DVC with a huge water reservoir. The Reservoir has small islands. These islands can be reached by row boats. The most famous island is Sabuj Dwip.
content=500 years old. About 2 km away
content=Another dam of DVC. About 30 km away.

- a seat seat rowing boat is Rs-300 and additional 20-50rs tip to the boatman allows you to experience rowing with your own hand. Also you have options to do paddle boating. Or take a hi-speed trip in a speed-boat by paying Rs-500.
If you are going by road, on the way back pickup
(sweet-meat speciality) from Shaktigarh, approx 20 km after
towards Kolkata. NH 2 by passes Bardhaman. If you want to buy other sweet-meat speciality such as
, then follow the old GT Road, which goes through the town and then get back to NH 2 after Bardhaman.

On the Jharkhand end of the Dam you can get a variety of chat, dhokla, golgappa, chana-bhatura etc. On the Bengal end, try the Paneer Pakora & Chicken Pokora from Chittaranjan Debnath's shop near Mazumder niwas.
You can enjoy thrills of three star dining at Maithon Hotel, sanjay chowk or try the chop cutlets in area 4.
